transportAdvice: Zermatt is a car-free village, making it highly walkable and best explored on foot; electric taxis and horse-drawn carriages are available for luggage or mobility needs. The village is served by a cog railway connecting it to the valley below, and gondolas and cable cars provide access to the surrounding mountain terrain.

weather.description: Cold and snowy with excellent ski conditions; one of the best months for winter sports enthusiasts.
Continued cold and snowy weather with reliable powder snow and long sunny spells at altitude.
Days grow longer and sunnier, offering some of the best spring skiing conditions of the season.
Snow begins to melt at lower elevations but high-altitude skiing remains possible; a quieter shoulder period.
Spring arrives in the village with mild temperatures and blooming meadows, though snow lingers on peaks.
Warm and pleasant for hiking but afternoon thunderstorms are common; trails begin to fully open.
Peak summer month with warm days and spectacular hiking; afternoon showers are frequent so mornings are best for outdoor activity.
Similar to July with warm temperatures and lush alpine scenery; the busiest tourist month of the year.
Cooler and quieter with crisp air and stunning autumn colours; an excellent month for hiking with fewer crowds.
Temperatures drop noticeably and early snowfall is possible at altitude; a quiet transitional period between seasons.
Cold and grey with early season snowfall building; ski lifts begin to open toward the end of the month.
Festive and wintry with reliable snow and a magical alpine atmosphere; the ski season is in full swing.
